title: Magic GRE tunnels
description: GRE tunnels that connect Cloudflare with your endpoints

links.title: List GRE tunnels
links.description: List GRE tunnels associated with an account's Magic setup

links.title: GRE Tunnel Details
links.description: Get a specific GRE tunnel for an account's Magic setup

links.title: Create GRE tunnels
links.description: Creates new GRE tunnels associated with an account's Magic setup. Use `?validate_only=true` as an optional query parameter to run validation only without persisting changes
links.curl:
curl -X POST "https://api.cloudflare.com/client/v4/accounts/01a7362d577a6c3019a474fd6f485823/magic/gre_tunnels?validate_only=true" \
     -H "X-Auth-Email: user@example.com" \
     -H "X-Auth-Key: c2547eb745079dac9320b638f5e225cf483cc5cfdda41" \
     -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
     --data '{"gre_tunnels":[{"name":"GRE_1","customer_gre_endpoint":"203.0.113.1","cloudflare_gre_endpoint":"203.0.113.1","interface_address":"192.0.2.0/31","description":"Tunnel for ISP X","ttl":64,"mtu":1476,"health_check":{"enabled":true,"target":"203.0.113.1","type":"request"}}]}'

name.description: Should be a valid Linux interface name, i.e., has no spaces, special characters, is 15 or less characters, and doesn't share a name with other GRE tunnels

customer_gre_endpoint.description: The IP address assigned to the customer side of the GRE tunnel

cloudflare_gre_endpoint.description: The IP address assigned to the Cloudflare side of the GRE tunnel

interface_address.description: A 31-bit prefix (/31 in CIDR notation) supporting 2 hosts, one for each side of the tunnel. Select the subnet from the following private IP space: 10.0.0.0–10.255.255.255, 172.16.0.0–172.31.255.255, 192.168.0.0–192.168.255.255.

description.description: An optional description of the GRE tunnel

ttl.description: Time To Live (TTL) in number of hops of the GRE tunnel. Minimum value 64

mtu.description: Maximum Transmission Unit (MTU) in bytes for the GRE tunnel. Maximum value 1476 and minimum value 576

enabled.description: Flag to run healthchecks for this tunnel (defaults to true)

target.description: Address to run healthchecks against (defaults to customer_gre_endpoint address)

type.description: Type of healthcheck to run (reply or request). Defaults to reply.

links.title: Update GRE Tunnel
links.description: Update a specific GRE tunnel for an account's Magic setup. Use `?validate_only=true` as an optional query parameter to run validation only without persisting changes
links.curl:
curl -X PUT "https://api.cloudflare.com/client/v4/accounts/01a7362d577a6c3019a474fd6f485823/magic/gre_tunnels/01a7362d577a6c3019a474fd6f485823?validate_only=true" \
     -H "X-Auth-Email: user@example.com" \
     -H "X-Auth-Key: c2547eb745079dac9320b638f5e225cf483cc5cfdda41" \
     -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
     --data '{"name":"GRE_1","customer_gre_endpoint":"203.0.113.1","cloudflare_gre_endpoint":"203.0.113.1","interface_address":"192.0.2.0/31","description":"Tunnel for ISP X","ttl":64,"mtu":1476,"health_check":{"enabled":true,"target":"203.0.113.1","type":"request"}}'

name.description: Should be a valid Linux interface name, i.e., has no spaces, special characters, is 15 or less characters, and doesn't share a name with other GRE tunnels

customer_gre_endpoint.description: The IP address assigned to the customer side of the GRE tunnel

cloudflare_gre_endpoint.description: The IP address assigned to the Cloudflare side of the GRE tunnel

interface_address.description: A 31-bit prefix (/31 in CIDR notation) supporting 2 hosts, one for each side of the tunnel. Select the subnet from the following private IP space: 10.0.0.0–10.255.255.255, 172.16.0.0–172.31.255.255, 192.168.0.0–192.168.255.255.

description.description: An optional description of the GRE tunnel

ttl.description: Time To Live (TTL) in number of hops of the GRE tunnel. Minimum value 64

mtu.description: Maximum Transmission Unit (MTU) in bytes for the GRE tunnel. Maximum value 1476 and minimum value 576

enabled.description: Flag to run healthchecks for this tunnel (defaults to true)

target.description: Address to run healthchecks against (defaults to customer_gre_endpoint address)

type.description: Type of healthcheck to run (reply or request). Defaults to reply.

links.title: Update Many GRE tunnels
links.description: Update many GRE tunnels for an account's Magic setup. Use `?validate_only=true` as an optional query parameter to run validation only without persisting changes
links.curl:
curl -X PUT "https://api.cloudflare.com/client/v4/accounts/01a7362d577a6c3019a474fd6f485823/magic/gre_tunnels?validate_only=true" \
     -H "X-Auth-Email: user@example.com" \
     -H "X-Auth-Key: c2547eb745079dac9320b638f5e225cf483cc5cfdda41" \
     -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
     --data '{"gre_tunnels":[{"id":"01a7362d577a6c3019a474fd6f485823","name":"GRE_1","customer_gre_endpoint":"203.0.113.1","cloudflare_gre_endpoint":"203.0.113.1","interface_address":"192.0.2.0/31","description":"Tunnel for ISP X","ttl":64,"mtu":1476,"health_check":{"enabled":true,"target":"203.0.113.1","type":"request"}}]}'

id.$comment: Must be present as a definition for URI Templating

links.description: Disable and remove a specific static GRE Tunnel for an account's Magic setup. Use `?validate_only=true` as an optional query parameter to run validation only without persisting changes
